# Recipe: Oven Baked Eggplant Parmesan

## Introduction
Oven Baked Eggplant Parmesan is a classic Italian dish that features layers of breaded and baked eggplant slices, marinara sauce, and melted cheese. This dish is known for its rich flavors and satisfying texture. It is a popular vegetarian option and is loved by both kids and adults.

## Ingredients
- 2 large eggplants
- 1 cup all-purpose flour
- 3 eggs, beaten
- 2 cups breadcrumbs
- 1/2 cup grated Parmesan cheese
- 2 cups marinara sauce
- 2 cups shredded mozzarella cheese
- Fresh basil leaves, for garnish
- Salt and pepper, to taste
- Olive oil, for brushing

## Equipment
- Baking sheet
- Mixing bowls
- Knife
- Cutting board
- Whisk
- Spatula

## Preparation Time
- 20 minutes

## Cooking Time
- 40 minutes

## Steps
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. Slice the eggplants into 1/4-inch thick rounds. Sprinkle salt on both sides of each slice and let them sit for 10 minutes to remove excess moisture. Pat dry with a paper towel.
3. Set up three shallow bowls: one with flour, one with beaten eggs, and one with a mixture of breadcrumbs, grated Parmesan cheese, salt, and pepper.
4. Dip each eggplant slice into the flour, shaking off any excess. Then dip it into the beaten eggs, allowing any excess to drip off. Finally, coat it in the breadcrumb mixture, pressing gently to adhere the breadcrumbs.
5. Place the breaded eggplant slices on a greased baking sheet. Brush the tops with olive oil.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes, or until the eggplant is golden brown and crispy.
7. Remove the baking sheet from the oven and spread marinara sauce over each eggplant slice. Top with shredded mozzarella cheese.
8. Return the baking sheet to the oven and bake for an additional 15-20 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
9. Remove from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes. Garnish with fresh basil leaves.
10. Serve the Oven Baked Eggplant Parmesan hot and enjoy!

## Serving Suggestions
- Serve the Oven Baked Eggplant Parmesan as a main course with a side of spaghetti or a fresh green salad.
- Pair it with garlic bread for a complete Italian meal.

## Variations
- For a healthier version, you can bake the eggplant slices without breading them. Simply brush them with olive oil and season with salt and pepper before baking.
- Add a layer of sliced tomatoes or roasted red peppers between the eggplant slices for added flavor and texture.
- Instead of marinara sauce, you can use pesto or a combination of both for a different twist.

## Tips and Tricks
- Make sure to slice the eggplant evenly to ensure even cooking.
- Removing excess moisture from the eggplant slices before breading helps them become crispy.
- If you prefer a spicier flavor, add a pinch of red pepper flakes to the breadcrumb mixture.
- For a vegetarian option, make sure to use vegetarian-friendly Parmesan cheese.

## Nutritional Information
- Serving Size: 1 slice (approximately 1/8 of the recipe)
- Calories: 252
- Fat: 9g
- Carbohydrates: 29g
- Protein: 12g

## Storage and Leftovers
- Store any leftovers of Oven Baked Eggplant Parmesan in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.
- Reheat in the oven or microwave before serving.

## Frequently Asked Questions
- Can I freeze Oven Baked Eggplant Parmesan?
  - Yes, you can freeze Oven Baked Eggplant Parmesan. However, the texture of the eggplant may change slightly upon thawing. It is best to freeze it before baking and add the marinara sauce and cheese after thawing.

- Can I use a different type of cheese?
  - Yes, you can use different types of cheese, such as cheddar or provolone, in place of mozzarella. Experiment with different cheeses to find your favorite combination.

- Can I make this recipe gluten-free?
  - Yes, you can use gluten-free breadcrumbs and flour to make this recipe gluten-free. Make sure to check the labels of the ingredients to ensure they are gluten-free.

- Can I make Oven Baked Eggplant Parmesan ahead of time?
  - Yes, you can prepare the breaded eggplant slices ahead of time and refrigerate them until ready to bake. You can also assemble the dish with the marinara sauce and cheese and refrigerate it before baking. Just make sure to adjust the baking time accordingly.
